str2: When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Corruptible, perishable. From phtheiro; decayed, i.e. perishable.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To put on, clothe (another). From en and duno; to invest with clothing.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From aphthartos; incorruptibility; genitive, unending existence; genuineness.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Mortal, subject to death. From thnesko; liable to die.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To put on, clothe (another). From en and duno; to invest with clothing.
Immortality, imperishability, freedom from death. From a compound of a and thanatos; deathlessness.
Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To drink down, swallow, devour, destroy, consume. From kata and pino; to drink down, i.e. Gulp entire.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Victory. From nike; a conquest, i.e. triumph.
